tool_description: This tool aims to create proteins with specific structures and functions. Specifically, protein design is to alter or design amino acid sequences to obtain novel proteins with desired properties. This process can aid scientists in developing new drugs, catalysts, materials, and more, with applications spanning biotechnology, medicine, industry, and research.

required_parameters.name: protein_structure
required_parameters.description: The PDB (Protein Data Bank) identifier of the protein structure used as input for the model. It defines the 3D structure of the protein to guide sequence prediction.

required_parameters.name: chains
required_parameters.description: Indicates the specific chain(s) within the PDB structure to be used for sequence prediction. Multiple chains can be specified if needed.

optional_parameters.name: homooligomer
optional_parameters.description: Indicates if the design is for a homooligomer.

optional_parameters.name: fix_pos
optional_parameters.description: Specify which positions to keep fixed in the sequence. You can also specify chain specific constraints or to fix entire chain(s).

optional_parameters.name: inverse
optional_parameters.description: Inverse the fix_pos selection to define positions to 'free' [or design] instead of 'fix'.

optional_parameters.name: protein_sequence
optional_parameters.description: Specify amino acid(s) to exclude from the design.

optional_parameters.name: sampling_temp
optional_parameters.description: Sampling temperature for amino acids. T=0.0 means taking argmax, T>>1.0 means sample randomly.

return_values.name: index
return_values.description: An identifier for each row representing a specific sequence and its associated scores.

return_values.name: score
return_values.description: Represents how well the generated sequence fits the model's predictions, with higher scores indicating better fits.

return_values.name: seqid
return_values.description: Sequence identity score that measures the similarity of the generated sequence to the target sequence, typically ranging from 0 to 1.

return_values.name: protein_sequence
return_values.description: The generated amino acid sequences predicted by the model based on the input data.
